ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English hennes, from Old English heonan ('from here'), probably related to Old English hēr ('here').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc. | Conjunction: a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: For this reason; therefore; as a consequence.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The experiment failed, hence the need for further research.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 实验失败了，因此有必要进行进一步的研究。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: From this place; away from here.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We shall go hence and never return.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们从此地离开，永不回来。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: From this time; in the future (used with a period of time).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从今以后（用于表示一段时间后的未来）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Three weeks hence, the results will be known.
